AMD4EVER

The NFL season has started and I am pumped up after the games this week! I really enjoyed watching the Bills cream the Patriots especially after that Milloy trade went through less than a week ago.
 
 So how many NFL fans do we have here? What are your favorite teams and who do you think is going to the Super Bowl this year?
 
 I have been a Bills fan since I was little. It has been 10 painful seasons and 4 blown Super Bowls but I have never waivered in my support of the team. This year is no different! Not too many people are predicting them to make the playoffs this year but I just gotta believe after their performance this week that they are going to show the world what they are made of! They will make the playoffs and I think they have an outside shot at fifth chance to lose the Super Bowl to the Tampa Bay Bucs! An obvious choice to win, I know, but I still think they are the best around in this extremely balanced league.
 
 Mix in some college football if you wish emoticon_smile
sundowner
ok, this is a debate forum, so just to debate you, football season did not really start yet. what proof do you have? any evidence? i think not. ask the phins, they didn't start playing yet! ;)
Crim
DA BEARSSSSSS...are not any good this year
AMD4EVER

ok, this is a debate forum, so just to debate you, football season did not really start yet. what proof do you have? any evidence? i think not. ask the phins, they didn't start playing yet! ;)

 
 Lets see how the phins do this Sunday against the all mighty Buffalo Bills!
 
 The ESPN Power Rankings had 4 of the top 5 teams lose this week with the Bills being the only ones who won! Could that mean they will get the cursed rank of #1 on the ESPN power rankings this week? Are the Bills actually the best team in the NFL right now? I don't think they are the best but with how bad some of the better teams have been doing, they just might be the only team that can legitimately be put at #1 this week other than the Chiefs.
wjim1269

DA BEARSSSSSS...are not any good this year

 
 I have to agree with you. They looked good at some points last night, but they really blew the game at the end.
AMD4EVER

I have to agree with you. They looked good at some points last night, but they really blew the game at the end.

 
 I have a friend that is a big Bears fan but he won't even watch them this year. I think he got too used to seeing them win a few years ago. I don't think I could ever be a fan of a team that isn't always trying to win and I don't believe the Bears management is really trying all that hard.
Crim

The Bears have the worst offensive coordinator I've ever seen. Some of the plays he comes up with don't make any sense. He runs a fake screen to the right and then has the throw go there anyways. He runs a fake run up the middle and then has Kordell run up the middle anyways.
 
 Of course, we can't have any discussion about John Shoop without mentioning his love of 3 yard passes on 3rd and long.
wjim1269

Of course, we can't have any discussion about John Shoop without mentioning his love of 3 yard passes on 3rd and long.

 
 I know. Those type of plays really get me mad.
Crim

I recall one time hearing one of the analysts just going into complete shock over one of the Bears' plays. He was like "...I don't think that play works on anything other than junior high football teams."
AMD4EVER

http://sports.espn.go.com/nfl/powerranking
 
 Oh that is just wrong! The Bills were ranked #4 last week and the Chiefs were #6. The 1st, 2nd, 3rd, and 5th ranked teams all lost so I expected the Bills to get the #1 ranking this week. But nuh uh! They get put at #2 behind the Chiefs. Not that I shouldn't be happy since the chart is cursed and being #1 generally means you lose, but still I wanted to see the Bills be on top just once because I know that is probably all they will get!
 
 Well as long as they beat Miami this week then they will have to be put at the top! The Chiefs are taking on the lowly Texans who are a gimme win and won't do anything but drop them in the rankings.
 
 Buffalo's gotta win!!!
Crim

Well as long as they beat Miami this week then they will have to be put at the top! The Chiefs are taking on the lowly Texans who are a gimme win and won't do anything but drop them in the rankings.
 
 
 Don't forget that the Texans beat the Dolphins.
AMD4EVER

Don't forget that the Texans beat the Dolphins.

 
 True, but I don't think that this was anything more than a rare instance. The Dolphins are the better team and some thought going into this season that they could win the AFC East. I still believe the Dolphins are this good and that is why I am worrying going into this game. I hope the Bills are deserving of the rank of #2 in the league but I doubt it and I think we could find that out in this game. If the Bills do win though, then I think their victory will be a powerful statement and raise expectations for the Bills even further. A win for the Chiefs over the Texans is almost assumed and I can't see them getting a whole lot of credit for a win there.
 
 PS: Lines for the games on Sunday: Dolphins by 3 and Chiefs by 7 1/2. The Bills are underdogs and the Chiefs are a given.
montalban

I'd like to remind Americans that you have a national team representing you in another football code...
 
 Rugby Union.
 
 Which has a world cup beginning early October
 http://www.irb.com/rwc2003_launch/
 
 I'd be very interested to know if any Americans are actually aware of this.
 
 
 There are teams from
 USA
 Canada
 England
 Australia
 Uraguay
 Argentina
 Romania
 Fiji
 France
 Italy
 Ireland
 New Zealand
 South Africa
 Namibia
 Japan
 Samoa
 Scotland
 Wales
 Tonga
 and Georgia (the country, not the USA state)
 
 
 
 
 Of course, Australia's team, the Wallabies will win.
AMD4EVER

Rugby? What the hell is that? emoticon_frazzled 
 
 The US probably has a sports team for almost every sport. We clearly have too much money to spend and no idea what to spend it on. Personally I'd rather take a tax break than have a rugby team!
montalban

Rugby? What the hell is that? emoticon_frazzled 
 
 The US probably has a sports team for almost every sport. We clearly have too much money to spend and no idea what to spend it on. Personally I'd rather take a tax break than have a rugby team!

 
 
 Rugby Union is considered to be the 'father' of American Football, as well as a more similar game Rugby League (which I follow, though I played Union at school.)
 
 But hey, it's a WORLD CUP... the top 20 nations, every five years... The USA'a Eagles will play Fiji, then Scotland, Japan and then France (ties in nicely with some other threads!)
 
 There's 15 on each team. Very little in the way of personal protection (such as no helmets). No forward passes. Just slamming yourself against your opponents... currently an Australian player is charging an South African for biting him on the shoulder!
 
 
 It's a great game! At school I almost had my left ear torn off from head clashes with opposing players!
AMD4EVER
